cuisines.quick_version: Mustard greens with cornmeal flatbread, iconic Punjabi winter delicacy.
cuisines.dish_name: Sarson Da Saag with Makki Di Roti
cuisines.description: Mustard greens cooked with spices served with cornmeal flatbread topped with white butter. Iconic Punjabi winter delicacy rich in flavor and nutrition.
cuisines.when_to_try: Best during winter months (November-February) when mustard greens fresh
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Amritsar dhabas, roadside eateries, authentic Punjabi restaurants, Golden Temple langar
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Only fresh in winter. Summer versions use frozen saag lacking authentic taste. Visit Punjab in winter.

cuisines.quick_version: Fermented rice pancakes with coconut milk stew, Kerala breakfast staple.
cuisines.description: Fermented rice pancakes with soft center and crispy edges, served with coconut milk-based vegetable or meat stew. Breakfast staple.
cuisines.when_to_try: Year-round breakfast dish, especially good during monsoon
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Kochi restaurants, Alleppey houseboats, traditional Kerala homes, coastal eateries
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Appam freshly made tastes best. Buffet pre-made appam becomes hard. Order fresh from kitchen.

cuisines.quick_version: Baked wheat balls with lentils and sweet crumble, Rajasthan's signature dish.
cuisines.description: Baked wheat balls (baati) served with mixed lentil curry (dal) and sweetened crumbled wheat (churma). Represents desert cuisine's heartiness.
cuisines.when_to_try: Year-round, especially during festivals and weddings
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Jaipur traditional restaurants, Jodhpur local eateries, heritage hotels, village tourism experiences
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Authentic baati is hard - must be dunked in ghee and dal to soften. Don't eat dry thinking it's bad quality.

cuisines.quick_version: Light fish curry with turmeric base, Bengali comfort food with rice.
cuisines.description: Light fish curry with potatoes in turmeric-based gravy. Bengali comfort food highlighting freshwater fish like rohu or katla.
cuisines.when_to_try: Year-round, especially during monsoon when fish abundant
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Kolkata home-style restaurants, Bengal fish markets with eateries, Sundarbans region
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Freshwater fish (rohu, katla, hilsa) is authentic. Tourists often get sea fish substitutes. Ask for traditional freshwater fish.

cuisines.quick_version: Intensely spicy chicken curry with freshly ground Chettinad spices.
cuisines.description: Spicy chicken curry from Chettinad region using freshly ground spices, coconut, curry leaves. Known for intense heat and complex flavor.
cuisines.when_to_try: Year-round, pairs well with dosa, rice, or parotta
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Chettinad restaurants in Chennai, Karaikudi specialty eateries, Tamil Nadu traditional hotels
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Genuinely spicy - not for show. Request 'medium spicy' if low tolerance. Indian 'spicy' can be overwhelming.

cuisines.quick_version: Mumbai's iconic spiced potato fritter in bread bun, 'Indian burger'.
cuisines.description: Mumbai's iconic street food - spiced mashed potato fritter (vada) in bread bun (pav) with chutneys. Often called 'Indian burger'.
cuisines.when_to_try: Year-round street food, especially good during monsoon
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Mumbai street stalls, Dadar vendors, Churchgate area, local railway stations
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Best from street vendors, not fancy restaurants. Authentic vada pav costs â‚¹15-30. Expensive mall versions aren't authentic.

cuisines.quick_version: Tangy coconut-based fish curry with kokum, Portuguese-Indian fusion.
cuisines.description: Tangy, spicy fish curry made with coconut, kokum, local spices. Portuguese-Indian fusion reflecting Goan coastal cuisine.
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Beach shacks, Goan home-style restaurants, Panjim eateries, coastal villages
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Should have tanginess from kokum/tamarind. If too creamy and mild, adapted for tourist palates. Ask for authentic spicy version.

cuisines.quick_version: Steamed fermented gram flour cake, light and healthy Gujarati snack.
cuisines.description: Steamed fermented gram flour cake, light and fluffy, tempered with mustard seeds and curry leaves. Healthy breakfast or snack.
cuisines.when_to_try: Year-round breakfast and snack, especially popular during festivals
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Ahmedabad street vendors, Gujarat farsan shops, breakfast eateries, traditional restaurants
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Should be soft and spongy. If dense and hard, it's old or poorly made. Fresh dhokla is key.

cuisines.quick_version: Tangy fish curry using tomatoes or elephant apple for sourness.
cuisines.description: Tangy fish curry using tomatoes, lemon, or elephant apple for sourness. Light, healthy preparation typical of Assamese cuisine.
cuisines.when_to_try: Summer months for refreshing sour taste, year-round availability
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Guwahati local restaurants, Assamese home-style eateries, Brahmaputra riverfront cafes
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Tenga means sour - if not tangy, not authentic. Should have pronounced sour taste.

cuisines.quick_version: Aromatic lamb curry with rich red gravy, signature Wazwan dish.
cuisines.description: Aromatic lamb curry with rich red gravy made using Kashmiri chilies, yogurt, traditional spices. Signature dish of Wazwan feast.
cuisines.when_to_try: Year-round, especially during winter and traditional Wazwan feasts
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Srinagar traditional restaurants, Wazwan specialists, Dal Lake houseboats, Kashmiri Pandit homes
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Authentic uses Kashmiri chili for color, not heat. If extremely spicy, not traditional. Should be flavorful but mildly spicy.

cuisines.quick_version: World-famous layered rice with meat in dum style, Hyderabad's crown jewel.
cuisines.description: World-famous layered rice dish with marinated meat, saffron, aromatic spices cooked in 'dum' style. Blends Mughal and Telugu influences.
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Hyderabad's Paradise, Bawarchi, Shah Ghouse, Old City biryani houses
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Authentic has layers - rice and meat cooked separately then layered and dum-cooked. If mixed like pulao, not authentic.

cuisines.quick_version: Steamed wheat bread stuffed with walnut or poppy seeds, Himachali specialty.
cuisines.description: Steamed wheat bread stuffed with walnut or poppy seed paste. Traditional Himachali dish served with ghee or dal.
cuisines.when_to_try: Winter specialty, available year-round in traditional homes and restaurants
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Manali local dhabas, Shimla traditional restaurants, Himachali homestays, mountain villages
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Should be eaten hot with ghee. Cold siddu becomes hard. Order fresh and eat immediately.

cuisines.quick_version: Rice and lentil pancakes cooked in earthen pots, Odia breakfast specialty.
cuisines.description: Fermented rice and black gram pancake cooked slowly in earthen pots. Sweet caramelized flavor from slow cooking. Odia specialty.
cuisines.when_to_try: Winter and festival times, especially Raja Parba and Manabasa Gurubara
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Bhubaneswar traditional eateries, Puri local homes, Odia sweet shops, temple prasad counters
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Authentic poda pitha cooked in earthen pot overnight. Modern versions lack caramelized flavor. Seek traditional preparation.

cuisines.quick_version: Roasted wheat balls with mashed vegetables, Bihari signature dish.
cuisines.description: Roasted wheat flour balls stuffed with sattu (roasted gram flour) served with mashed vegetables (chokha) - potato, eggplant, tomato. Bihar's signature dish.
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Patna street vendors, Bihari dhabas, traditional homes, roadside stalls
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Litti should be roasted over charcoal for smoky flavor, not baked in oven. Charcoal roasting makes it authentic.

cuisines.quick_version: Rice and lentil dumplings steamed in jackfruit leaves, Mangalorean specialty.
cuisines.description: Thin rice crepes (neer dosa) served with spicy chicken curry and crispy rice wafers (rotti). Mangalorean coastal specialty.
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Mangalore restaurants, Udupi traditional eateries, coastal Karnataka homes
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Neer dosa should be very thin and soft. Thick versions aren't authentic. Made without fermentation unlike regular dosa.

cuisines.quick_version: Grated corn cooked in milk with spices, Indore street food specialty.
cuisines.description: Grated corn cooked in milk with spices and garnished with coriander, lemon. Indore's famous street food, creamy and flavorful.
cuisines.when_to_try: Monsoon and post-monsoon (July-October) when corn is fresh
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Indore street stalls, Sarafa Bazaar night market, local eateries
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Best with fresh tender corn during monsoon season. Off-season versions lack sweetness and texture.

cuisines.quick_version: Pork with fermented bamboo shoots, signature Khasi tribal dish.
cuisines.description: Rice cooked with pork, black sesame, and local spices. Sometimes includes pig blood. Khasi tribal specialty representing Meghalaya cuisine.
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Shillong local eateries, Khasi tribal homes, Cherrapunji homestays, Police Bazaar restaurants
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Authentic versions use pig blood which some find off-putting. Specify if you prefer without blood. Flavor is rich and earthy.

cuisines.quick_version: Smoked pork with fermented bamboo shoot and naga chili, extremely spicy.
cuisines.description: Smoked pork cooked with akhuni (fermented soybean) and raja mircha (bhut jolokia - ghost pepper). Intensely spicy and flavorful Naga cuisine.
cuisines.recommended_places_generic: Kohima local eateries, tribal homestays, Hornbill Festival food stalls
cuisines.avoid_common_mistake: Bhut jolokia is world's hottest chili. Request less spicy version if needed. Akhuni has strong fermented smell - acquired taste.
